content: Rohan, attached is v1.0 of your personal Peak Performance Playbook. It contains the precise pre-event nutrition, stress inoculation, and biofeedback protocols that led to your keynote success. This is now a permanent asset in your toolkit.
Got it Neel, this feels solid. Exactly the kind of repeatable system I need. Thanks for pulling it together 🙏
Morning Rohan! Sarah has confirmed your consultation with Dr. Alice Chen (clinical psychologist) for Feb 10, 2pm. She specializes in exec stress resilience. It’s already in your calendar ✅
Perfect, thanks Ruby. Appreciate how seamless you make this.

Rohan, to complement Dr. Chen’s work and give us a real-time lens, I recommend trialing a continuous daytime HRV monitor. It'll show how meetings/tasks impact your nervous system—basically stress in real-time.
So the Oura ring gives me the overnight 'recharge' score, while this new monitor would give me the real-time 'drain' score during the day? Almost like managing my energy as a battery?
Exactly 👌 That’s the perfect analogy. With both data streams, we’ll know when you’re fully charged vs when your battery is draining too quickly.
Alright, let’s trial it. If it’s frictionless to wear, I’m in.
Noted 👍 I’ll handle logistics and have the HRV device couriered to your office by Thursday. Setup guide will be in the box, but I’ll also send a quick walkthrough.

Rohan, as we prep for your mid-February diagnostics, I recommend adding APOE4 genetic testing. It’s a key marker for both cardiovascular and Alzheimer’s risk. Knowing your status shapes long-term prevention.
Interesting. I’ve read about APOE4 in relation to Alzheimer’s… so this would let us take a more proactive stance if I carry it?
Exactly. If positive, we’d optimize diet, exercise, and cognitive training earlier. If negative, you gain peace of mind. Either way, it’s valuable foresight.
Makes sense. Let’s add it in with the Feb bloods then.
Got it Rohan. I’ll add APOE4 to your Feb requisition. No extra appointments needed ✅
Quick check-in: how’re the fasted cardio sessions going? Any dizziness or flare-ups with the POTS?
Did 3 sessions last week, one got cut short because of lightheadedness. Overall feels good though, especially post-session clarity.
That’s encouraging 👍 If dizziness persists, shorten warmup + hydrate earlier. Keep HR in zone 2 for now.
Rohan, quick one—your cook has been consistent with meal photos 👌 I’m seeing better carb-timing alignment. How’re you feeling with the reintroduction?
Honestly—no crashes, digestion feels smoother. Big shift from before. Thanks for coaching the kitchen directly, makes it painless for me.
Love hearing that. Metabolic flexibility is exactly what we want long term 🚀
Morning! Courier just dropped the HRV monitor at your office. Should be on your desk. Want me to WhatsApp you the 3-step setup now or after work?
Thanks Ruby, after work’s better. Meetings back-to-back this morning.
Got it 👍 Setup is: 1) Charge for 30 min, 2) Pair via app (QR code in box), 3) Wear on non-dominant arm. That’s it. Should auto-sync.
Done in under 10 mins. Nice. Let’s see what the data says tomorrow.
First HRV stream looks clean ✅ Yesterday your biggest drop was around 3pm—any chance that was the investor call?
Ha, good catch. Yes, that was the call. Stress spike makes sense.
This is exactly the value—linking events to physiology. We’ll build counter-strategies for those stress-heavy windows.
Feels very actionable. Almost like building my own performance dashboard.
Reminder: Sarah confirmed your diagnostics are booked for Feb 15th, 8am @ Mount Elizabeth. I’ll send a prep checklist next week.
Great, block it in. Thanks for staying ahead of it.
Quick strategic note—your Playbook is a living doc. As we see results from HRV + Dr Chen, we’ll add those layers. Treat it as your personal ops manual.
Understood. It’s reassuring having it consolidated in one place.
Morning Rohan—any muscle soreness creeping in from the new circuits?
A little in the hamstrings but nothing that lingers. Recovery feels better than 2 months ago.
Good sign 🙌 Keep post-session stretches consistent, that’s preventing flare-ups.
Just reviewed yesterday’s dinner log—fantastic protein balance. That supports recovery perfectly.
Thanks Carla, credit goes to the cook following your notes. It’s pretty effortless for me now.
Happy Monday! This week focus is stability—HRV monitor on, nutrition steady, prep for Feb 10 with Dr. Chen. I’ll coordinate with Sarah on any schedule bumps.
Perfect. Thanks Ruby, you’ve got everything covered.
Zooming out: you now have playbook + real-time stress data + mental resilience pillar coming online. That’s a very robust system build, Rohan.
